shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily Office prayers and litanies (fols. 3ra-18vb) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 18vb-62vb) III) Anaphoras (fols. 62vb-177ra) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 62vb-79va) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ preceded by an excerpt from the “Book of the Testament” (fols. 80va-80va) (cp. MQ, IV, Qǝddase ʾǝgziʾ, §§1-17) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 84va-95va) III-4) Anaphora of St. John, Son of Thunder (fols. 95va-107rb) III-5) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 107rb-117rb) III-6) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 117rb-130rb) III-7) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 130rb-138ra) III-8) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 138ra-144rb) III-9) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 144rb-152ra) III-10) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 152ra-154vb) III-11) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 154vb-161va) III-12) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 161va-168rb) III-13) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 168rb-177ra) IV) Śǝrʿatä betä krǝstiyan “The Order of the Church” (fols. 177rb-179va). In Amharic
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: Supplication formulas mention Däbrä Ṣǝyon, ʾabunä Kǝflä Maryam, ʾabunä Wäldä Rufaʾel, Wälättä Nǝgǝśt (s. fols. 79ra, 79vb, 107rb, etc., the last two names are crossed out, s. fols. 144rb, 161va).

dcomments.dcomment: On fol. 63ra, Patriarch of Alexandria Ṗeṭros (in tenure 1809-52) and Metropolitan Qerǝllos (in tenure in 1816-28) are mentioned.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn. Some fols. are heavily stained with dirt. Front cover is cracked and repaired; the spine cover is slightly damaged. Fol. 41 is slightly rumpled. Fol. 140 has been cut along the lower edge. A modern exercise paper book with prayers is placed between the last fols. of the Ms.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather. Overback made of reddish-brown leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8/fols. 75r-82r) – XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – XII(6/fols. 91r-96v) – XIII(10/fols. 97r-106v) – XIV(10/fols. 107r-116v) – XV(10/fols. 117r-126v) – XVI(10/fols. 127r-136v) – XVII(10/fols. 137r-146v) – XVIII(10/fols. 147r-156v) – XIX(10/fols. 157r-166v) – XX(8/fols. 167r-174v) – XXI(6/s. l.: 3, stub after 4; 4, stub after 3/fols. 175r-180v).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 127r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 97r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 127r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 97r). Structural pricks are partly visible (s. fols. 46v-47r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 3ra-29rb; 31va-179va. Hand b: fols. 29va-30rb.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ተሣ፡ for ተሣሀለነ፡ (s. fol. 13vb) እግ፡ ተ፡ for እግዚኦ፡ ተሣሀለነ፡ (s. fol. 13vb) እወ፡ እግ፡ አም፡ አኃ፡ ኵ፡ ዘይ፡ ለኵ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ ለኢ፡ ወመ፡ ኢየ፡ ክር፡ for እወ፡ እግዚኦ፡ አምላክነ፡ አኃዜ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዘይነግሥ፡ ለኵሉ፡ ዓለም፡ አቡሁ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ (s. fol. 14rb) አ፡ አ፡ for አሜን፡ አሜን፡ (s. fol. 169rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Text IV is identical with the Amharic section of Text V in Ms. SSB-005.

additional.cont: Fols. 1va-2va: Excerpts from the Gospels (Mt. 5:1-18, Lk. 6:1-5).
additional.det: At the beginning of the text (fol. 1va, l.1-6), an excerpt from the Gospel of John was begun and later crossed out (Jn. 10:1).

additional.cont: Fol. 179va-vb: Unreadable note.
additional.det: The greater part of the note has been erased. The legible fragment consists of several personal names (donation note?).

extras.extra: - Rubrications in reddish-brown ink begin in fol. 161ra. - The right upper corner of fol. 135 has been mended by sewing a strip of parchment. The corresponding text on both sides of the strip is written by a different hand, possibly identical with the hand of the exercise book (s. below). - A school pupil’s exercise book is attached to the Ms. between fols. 179 and 180. The exercise book contains a selection of Psalms, written by fine hand. - Writing exercises: fol. 2vb. - Crude notes writen in the upper margin: fols. 70v, 76r, 79v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Coloured threads inserted close to the right upper corner of fols. 69 (yellowish-brown) and 84 (red).
